intro: Paraixeris denticulatoplatyphylla, commonly known as the toothed flat-leaf parasol, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features broad, flat leaves with a distinctive toothed margin, which aids in identifying it. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in a circular pattern, and bloom during the warmer months. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
